Welcome to Contacts app’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶

The custom_middleware function is a middleware function that adds the time it took to process the request in seconds as a header called ‘performance’

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • call_next – Call the next middleware in the chain

Returns:

A response object

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something is wrong with our connection.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dict with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶

The limit_access_by_ip function is a middleware function that limits access to the API by IP address. It checks if the client’s IP address is in ALLOWED_IPS, and if not, returns a 403 Forbidden response.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Access the request object

  • call_next – Callable: Pass the next function in the chain

Returns:

An error if the ip address is not allowed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.root(request: Request)¶

The root function is the entry point of the application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which renders an HTML template using Jinja2. The template is located in templates/index.html and uses data from the request object to render itself.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get the request object for the current request

Returns:

A templateresponse object, which contains the template index

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, like connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A list of coroutines

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the jwt token

  • body – ContactModel: Deserialize the request body into a contactmodel object

  • db – Session: Create a new contact in the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who is deleting the contact. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be deleted. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user who is deleting the contact

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthdays(user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user that is currently logged in

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_email(user: User, email: str, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_email function takes in a user and an email address, and returns the contact associated with that email address.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • email – str: Filter the database query by email

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(user: User, contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact from the database by its id.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • contact_id – int: Filter the database by contact id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact with the given id

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_phone(user: User, phone: str, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_phone function returns a contact object from the database based on the user’s id and phone number.
Args:

user (User): The User object that is associated with the contact. phone (str): The phone number of the desired Contact object.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is making the request

  • phone – str: Filter the contact by phone number

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(user: User, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user id

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before starting to return rows

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(user: User, query: str, db: Session)¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who is searching for contacts. query (str): The search query string, which can be a name, surname, email or phone number of a contact.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • query – str: Search for a contact in the database

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(user: User, contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

user (User): The user who is making the request. contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be updated. body (ContactModel): A ContactModel object containing all of the information for updating a contact.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Check if the user is authorized to update a contact

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the updated contact information

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that has been updated

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we are looking for

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object or none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object with the updated avatar url

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • refresh_token – Update the user’s refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency injection

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the credentials from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A new access_token and a new refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A message that the email has been sent

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. An email with an activation link is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user’s information from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A usermodel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contactmodel object, which is the same as the

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be deleted, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The deleted contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_birthdays(db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_birthdays function returns a list of contacts that have birthdays in the current month.

The user is passed as an argument to ensure that only the logged-in user’s contacts are returned.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. The function takes in an optional contact_id parameter, which defaults to 1 if not provided. It also takes in a db Session object and user object as parameters, both of which are provided by dependency injection.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that we want to get

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the maximum value of a parameter

  • offset – int: Skip the first offset contacts

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(query: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.

Parameters:

  • query – Optional[str]: Search for contacts

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the query

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing all fields that are to be updated. If no such contact exists, it returns 404 Not Found error. Otherwise it updates the fields and returns 200 OK.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the information from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id in the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then returns it.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Pass the current user to the function

Returns:

The current user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Receive the file from the client

  • current_user – User: Get the current user’s email

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the secret key and algorithm

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that is to be encoded

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the secret key and algorithm

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s id, username, and email

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A string

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to be decoded

Returns:

The email of the user that is associated with the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db session, and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class attributes

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object from the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If so, it returns the email address from the payload’s sub field. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message &quot;Invalid scope for token&quot;. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT, we raise another HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocess

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is to be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is being verified

  • hashed_password – Compare the plain_password parameter to the hashed password in our database

Returns:

A boolean value, true or false

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Cloud Image¶

class src.services.cloud_image.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static generate_name_avatar(email: str)¶

The generate_name_avatar function takes an email address as a string and returns the first 12 characters of its SHA256 hash. This is used to generate a unique name for each user’s avatar image.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed into the function

Returns:

A string with the path to the avatar file

Doc-author:

Trelent

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.api.resource call) and returns the URL for that avatar image, which will be used to display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Identify the image in cloudinary

  • r – Get the version of the image

Returns:

The url for the avatar image

Doc-author:

Trelent

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. If no public_id is provided, one will be generated automatically.

Parameters:

  • file – Specify the file to be uploaded

  • public_id – str: Set the public id of the image

Returns:

A dictionary with the image data

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that users can click on within their emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass in the username of the user that is being registered

  • host – str: Pass in the host of the website

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
